title: Frankie Bridge gives an insight into breastfeeding as she eats chips in her hospital bed
text:
She welcomed her second son Carter back in 2015.

And Frankie Bridge went back in time on Instagram on Friday as she shared a candid motherhood snap taken with her newborn youngest child.

The Saturdays star, 30, posted a photo of herself munching on chips while breastfeeding the tot from her hospital bed shortly after his birth.

Honest: Frankie Bridge went back in time on Instagram on Friday as she shared a candid motherhood snap taken with her newborn youngest child

Carter, who Frankie shares with footballer husband Wayne, was seen lying in a cute striped babygro as he was fed by his mother. A bowl of chips lay next to the pair as Frankie munched on one and looked guiltily at the camera.

Writing in the caption beside her post, the singer said: 'This is one of the first pictures I sent my mates when I’d just had Carter.'

She added: 'Definitely not one of those beautiful serene pics I thought I’d get... he’s so tiny! He always asks me when he’ll be a baby again... he’s grown so much... but he’ll always be my baby.'

It comes after Frankie admitted she 'cried like a baby' when she dropped Carter and her eldest son Parker, five, at school after the summer holidays.

Heartfelt: The Saturdays star, 30, posted a photo of herself munching on chips while breastfeeding the tot from her hospital bed shortly after his birth in 2015

It was Parker's first day in Reception class and Frankie, a former member of S Club 8, revealed her sons' approaches to school surprised her.

She had expected Parker to be more confident about joining Year One, and thought Carter would be more emotional after complaining he doesn't want to enter into Reception.

The doting mother-of-two shared: 'You didn’t think I’d miss out on the 1st day of school pic did you?!!! This morning was an emotional one and not for the reason I thought it would be...

Milestones: Frankie recently admitted she 'cried like a baby' when she dropped Carter (right) and her eldest son Parker, five, at school after the summer holidays

'Obviously I’m totally devastated that my baby is now big and at school, he broke the rules and got big!

'However after months of saying he doesn’t want to go... he went in without a care in the world... the eldest one I wasn’t worried about... made me cry like a baby!

'He was so nervous about having a new teacher and when I walked past his class and saw him sitting alone my heart just broke...'

Frankie and her former Premier League and England footballer husband Wayne married in 2014.
description: Frankie Bridge went back in time on Instagram on Friday as she shared a candid motherhood snap taken with her newborn youngest child.
